description_txt: stated on November 14, 2011 in a political ad:
quote_txt: "41 cents out of every dollar (the U.S. spends) is borrowed from places like China."

description_txt: stated on November 14, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: The United States' regulations "are among the most difficult in the world."

description_txt: stated on October 27, 2011 in testimony at a state pension hearing:
quote_txt: "The job [of correctional officer] lowers your life expectancy . . . Metropolitan did a study in, I believe it was 1998, and the life expectancy was 58."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 16, 2011

description_txt: stated on November 13, 2011 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: After losing 750,000 jobs a month before this administration, the U.S. economy under Barack Obama has had 20 straight months of growth, has added 2.8 million jobs in the private sector and added "millions of jobs in manufacturing."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2011 in remarks at the Cornerstone Action Dinner in Manchester, N.H.:
quote_txt: Under energy efficiency legislation sponsored by U.S. Sen. Jeanne Shaheen, "federal bureaucrats could take over the local building code enforcement in your city if so-called ‘green mandates’ are not complied with quickly enough."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2011 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "(President Barack Obama gave) half a billion in taxpayer money to help his friends at Solyndra, a business the White House knew was on the path to bankruptcy."

description_txt: stated on November 12, 2011 in a Republican presidential debate in Spartanburg, S.C.:
quote_txt: "Torture is illegal by our laws. It's illegal by international laws."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in a news release:
quote_txt: Gov. Scott Walker received a $7,300 pay raise.

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2011 in a press release:
quote_txt: "[A]n extra 8 million Americans [are] projected to join state Medicaid programs in the next few years."

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2011 in a news release.:
quote_txt: George Allen's flat tax "plan would actually shrink revenues further than the Perry (flat tax) plan."

description_txt: stated on November 3, 2011 in an interview with Ohio Capital Blog’s Marc Kovac:
quote_txt: "The governor won this state with 49 percent. We had some of the closest races in the House in history. So you’re not dealing with this 70-30, like they want to make it."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in a speech.:
quote_txt: Says Suzanne Bonamici "supports the $500 billion cut to Medicare passed last year."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in a Republican presidential debate in Michigan:
quote_txt: "By 2014, there will be one administrator for every teacher on college campuses in the United States."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2011 in an article on the group's website:
quote_txt: Under a Wisconsin bill, "minor offenses such as violating pet leash laws, seat belt laws, parking infractions, etc., would now be arrestable offenses."

description_txt: stated on October 8, 2011 in a meeting:
quote_txt: Georgia has had ʺmore bank failures than any other state.ʺ

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "We cut a record $15 billion from our state budget."

description_txt: stated on November 1, 2011 in an MSNBC interview with Al Sharpton:
quote_txt: "More than half of the people on food stamps today are children."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: The federal "limousine fleet has increased by 42 percent since Barack Obama took office."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2011 in an email newsletter:
quote_txt: Says the Treasury Department "says 41 percent of all business income reported on individual returns would be hit by the [millionaires’] surtax" that "would harm small businessmen and women, the very people we are counting on to create new jobs."

description_txt: stated on October 26, 2011 in a hearing:
quote_txt: "Sixty-percent of the state retirees...don’t get Social Security.’’

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2011 in a TV interview.:
quote_txt: "Ronald Reagan raised the national debt 18 times."

description_txt: stated on November 8, 2011 in an interview on The Daily Show:
quote_txt: Solar and wind energy are "both cheaper than nuclear right now."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in an interview with Jon Stewart on "The Daily Show":
quote_txt: In April 2009 "the Democrats were in control, and the congressional (approval) rating was 40 percent."

description_txt: stated on October 11, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "In Wisconsin, Gov. Scott Walker has created a manufacturing-led jobs recovery. 30,000 new jobs were created this year, with 15,000 created in the struggling manufacturing sector."

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2011 in a letter to the the Postal Regulatory Commission chairwoman:
quote_txt: "No other public or private business in America" except for the U.S. Postal Service must fund 100 percent of employee retirement and retirement health costs in advance.

description_txt: stated on September 29, 2011 in a campaign video.:
quote_txt: President Barack Obama, Nancy Pelosi and Harry Reid support Rick Perry’s "decision to give in-state tuition to illegal immigrants."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2011 in a Republican presidential debate in Michigan:
quote_txt: "By 2015, we will be sending so much interest" to China that "we will be paying for the entire People's Liberation Army."

description_txt: stated on November 5, 2011 in a meeting:
quote_txt: The city of Pembroke Pines doesn't have a vote in a plan to build a detention center in Southwest Ranches.

description_txt: stated on November 6, 2011 in an ABC interview with Christiane Amanpour:
quote_txt: "Over half of the people who would be taxed under (a millionaire surtax) are, in fact, small businesspeople."

description_txt: stated on November 1, 2011 in a campaign news release:
quote_txt: A bill supported by Gov. Scott Walker makes it "so that drunk drivers who kill have an easier time of it."
